comment: I took this online and it was easy to manage and the lecture notes were very clear on the focus of the course. My only critique is I wish there was better feedback on the tests so I would know what to change for the next ones when I got a lower grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She is the worst professor I've ever endured throughout my college tenure. I don't understand why she hasn't gotten fired yet. She has no clear grading criteria and I think she enjoys failing students for fun. Please do not take her if you plan on going to law school. SAVE YOUR GPA!

To be so real, yes, this professor is hard, her feedback is vague. I know she does not sound great but since this class is online you are really teaching yourself through the textbooks. BUT she really cares about writing style: provide basic information to show you have read (on exams and papers) + write WELL, then the class is not so bad.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This class is the worst class I have taken. I am a straight A student and I am hoping for a C. If any of the following apply to you don't take Stricko. You plan on applying for grad school. You enjoy actually being taught the subject of the class you signed up for instead of being given a list of readings, you value your sanity.

I'm a straight A student. I just got a 60% on her midterm. I don't get 60s. Her feedback was terrible. I still don't understand why I got the grade I did. She gives no partial credit, and her grading is very subjective. Stay away. This class made me hate legal studies.

Don't take it; she did not lecture us about absolutely anything; yes, it was online, but she absolutely did not respond well to emails, etc. zero grading clarity, the notes for the exam grades arent constant and has no clear criteria, she was not a good professor and did not care about students, she offered zero extra credit either or other chances
impossible to reach her outside of class and takes a long time grading, but is very lenient with grades. only four assignments total
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Really, truly, the WORST professor I've ever had in 20+ years of schooling. Only take her if you like to suffer, struggle, and want to hate your life. There are no lectures so it's ultimately a self-study class and you're paying $600 for her to teach you. She does not teach. If you like law, you will hate it by the end of this class.
The long essays are pretty challenging, but you only have to do ten discussions posts with no replying.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Tests are very hard but discussion posts are easy and you dont have to reply to any classmates. I wouldnt take her class again though because of tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Get ready to read

comment: You are graded on ten discussion posts and three exams. The exams are graded really heavily and her feedback is not great.

Her tests are very hard. Hey grading rubrics are confusing. I would not take this class again. I worked so hard to get an A but ultimately the tests weighed very heavy versus all of the other discussions that we did.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Impossible to pass tests. They seem easy at first but she takes off for every little mistake and doesn't explain why. I had one comment on my last exam and got a 75%. Exams are 4 questions and require extensive reading. Discussions are fairly easy but only count for 25% of your grade while exams are 25% each. Take someone else if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Stricko is one of the best professors you could take. Not only is she truly passionate about her work but she is determined to help you truly learn the material. You do read and write in her classes but nothing thats too difficult. I love that she gives feedback on your work so you can see your level of understanding. Id take her again.

I took Dr. Stricko for my internship course and she was fantastic. The course required very few things from me but she would always read over them and give feedback. She is very personable and is one of those professors that makes this school great. She is also a great ally to have for doing research, she is very intelligent and gives good advice.

This class was not the easiest in the whole world, but that is kind of the point. Look up the IRAC method before you take it. That is the secret to passing all of her tests. I only really got points taken off if I cited the wrong court case. Other than that, she was always fair. Read the textbook and set aside a good chunk of time for the classwork

Not much of a class, mainly reading a chapter/week. KNOW THE CASES in the textbook - she creates hypothetical situations around these cases on the tests. Only have to complete 10/16 discussion posts. 10 Discussions (25%) and 3 Tests (Final included, 75%). If you can, buy a subscription to Quimbee - they help explain the cases in layman's terms.

I took her online for US Constitutions & I will say the discussion posts are easy but her test grading is very inconsistent, they are hypothetical situations you have to compare to cases. She isnt consistent with the amount of points she takes off its very annoying.

The class itself isn't the easiest but she does what she can to make it bearable. Discussion post every week basically graded for participation. I got a 100 on everyone. Only required to be 1016 post for the semester. 3 test which she grades fairly easy, but the class itself does require a lot of reading!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This was one of the worst experiences I've had at KSU. I've taken dozens of online courses and never had an issue with assignments or communication - she completely lacked any constructive feedback and it really affected how the class went. Multiple complaints.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I give her an F. She does not teach, rather she takes anger out on her students. Her test questions are hypothetical questions about the Simpsons and other just odd scenarios that have no basis in law. Then she says your answers are wrong and gives ZERO explanations on why. Dont take her unless you want to be angry for a few months.

The textbook is key to this class. All the tests cover are the case studies in the book. Discussions (you only have to do 5 of the 8) are super easy as long as you show that you put effort into them. For the tests, be as specific as possible and use quotes from the case studies. It requires some reading, but it's not a difficult class to pass.

GREAT professor. She is more concerned that you do the work and is not a heavy grader. Discussion posts are due every week but you only have to complete 10 throughout the entire semester. Super easy. She doesn't really announce the exams so you need to review the syllabus to make sure you don't forget. YOU NEED THE BOOK FOR THE EXAMS.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She was amazing. Easy to pass if you just do the couple of hours worth of reading every week. Their are online post weekly about the reading. There is also 3 test. I did not do great on the first one but was able to figure out what she was looking for by the next two.

Great professor. In the class you do 10 easy discussion post about stuff you learned from the book. I did not want to buy the book but ended up making 100% on all discussion post (stuff you can look up online) The only problems I had were the test. She want you to be so specific and you never know cause there are so many court cases. Easy A though!

Dr. Stricko is a great professor. There is a lot of material that you are required to know for this class but Dr. Stricko does a great job of answering questions and clarifying anything that may be unclear. You have to work very hard for your grade but if you need help with anything she is more than happy to help! I would recommend.

Dr. Stricko's classes could be considered tough, although I nothing I wouldn't expect from an upper level course. Though she doesn't take role, it would be a great benefit to attend. She tends to take a more passive role in class discussions, allowing students to discuss the readings while she moves the conversation forward. All in all, not too bad

I was told her class is hard from many students. Upon taking her class I barely studied for the midterm and got a 95. She likes creativity. One the paper everyone was worried that they didn't style the paper perfectly. She did that on purpose to see what students would do and did grade against it.

Took three online classes during the summer and this class was the least stressful. We had 3 exams plus 5 discussions each worth 20 points. Grade was out of 400 points. She does not mess around with your time and fill it with nonsense busy work. If your busy and need a class, then this may be what you need. Read the court cases and your fine.

I took this class online and wish that I hadn't She is inconsistent in what she is looking for on her exams. She provides an example of what she expects and then it's not what she's looking for when she grades. She also never had the tests back in a timely manner We only had 3 tests and 5 discussion posts on which we were graded. Don't take her!

Took online Constitution class and really liked how she set up the class.  She gave all the instructions clearly and gave us latitude to do what we thought was best.  She gave us suggestions on how to take notes but didn't require us to to turn them in.  Her tests were a bit tricky but nothing that I didn't think was fair.  Would take her again.

Prof is a great teacher in the classroom.  Discussions are interesting and she is open to all sides of the debate.  Exams are tough but doable if you study and keep up with the readings.  Don't miss class!  The lecture notes and very helpful.

Class is online so you can go at your own pace.  Syllabus is clear and due dates are obvious - basically every week. Class is not easy but a good grade is doable as long as you keep up with the readings and study.  Ask for help if needed and you'll be ok.

I would not recommend anyone take this teacher, she does not make clear what she's looking for in her postings and if she says she's going to assist you she never responds after the fact making you miss and fail the assignment. She's horrible! If you want to waste time and money take her otherwise go with Gillespie.

I took the online class and it was easy. Just read the case once and make sure you understand the concept and MEMORIZE THE CASE NAMES. I was good for an A and I'm not particularly smart or knowledgeable in law.

Very interesting & laid back, loves what she teaches. Very clear about what is on test, take good notes, read material (text book was understandable & pretty interesting), study quizzes (all online, but timed, so you should use notes), should do ok on test if you do all that. She randomly takes attendance which sucks - MUST ATTEND!

Very interesting & laid back, loves what she teaches. Very clear about what is on test, take good notes, read material (text book was understandable & pretty interesting), study quizzes (all online, but timed, so you should use notes), should do ok on test if you do all that. MUST ATTEND! She randomly takes attendance which sucks - MUST ATTEND!

She was very unclear with what we needed to know for her test (which were hard b/c she asked random questions) and she doesn't teach anything, she just answers people questions about the readings. I studied a lot for all 3 exams and still made in the 70's. She is also very unfair with the grading! Unless you like reading text books, stay away!

Dr. Stricko-Neubauer is a great professor. You have to be prepared to do the work and reading.. Lazy people need not sign up! The class is really interesting especially if you are interested in law. I really enjoyed her class and look forward to taking her in the future.

She is an awesome person. Really loves what she teaches. Her tests are a little tough, but if you study the quizzes and your notes you should make an A. She hates when people don't come to class, and if you do she will make it worth your while. Loved Her.
Cool Class.  She's a nice teacher and teaches an interesting subject.
This teacher is the best.  If you are interested in the first amendment or law, this class will be the one for you.  I have had her for several classes and she is my favorite teacher.

Have to agree about the inconsistent grading of papers. There were only 15 questions on each test. To study read the book, highlight the important points and then study what you DID NOT highlight. She went back and gave credit for three bad questions, she should have thrown out a few more that were ambiguous. She was fair about that.

I took this as an online class summer semester. The class itself was not too difficult and I found the material very interesting. Class consists of 4 tests and 3 papers. I thought she graded the papers harshly, and then on the last paper I got a 100. I felt like all my papers were pretty much the same quality wise, but I guess not.
I really enjoyed this class, and  I thought Dr.Neubauer was a great instructor. She is very fair. She seems to care about the students, and she is flexible. I highly recommend her!

Dr. Stricko-Neubauer taught this class on-line. It is a review of the Supreme Court History. The content was not so interesting to me but the professor was great about communicating and made all policies and guidelines CLEAR! She is super responsive and encourages people to use their brain! I would recommend taking her classes - VERY FAIR!!
